page.title: 18EDUCATION
page.content: In Porthleven there are two schools, an infant and a junior school on the same site. The junior school opened in September 1975 and the infants school in March 1980. Before this there were two separate schools called the Church School and the Board School. The Church School stood next to St Bartholomews, the Parish Church, and is now the Christadelphian Meeting Room. The Board School was used by the infants until their new building was ready. It is now used as a store for nets, boats and crab pots. In 1967 when the Torrey Canyon was wrecked off the Seven Stones Reef the Board school was used by the Royal Hampshire Regiment who came to clear away the oil. The army gave the school a shield which we still have.
